storyInfo: Disregarding a Medic Operator's attempts to dissuade her, Eyjafjalla insists on taking an expedition to a volcanic belt near the route of the Rhodes Island.

attributes.content: Can I start now? I thought I saw the record button flash for a moment, but it might've just been my imagination. Oh... feels like it's starting to warm up... so I guess it's working?
attributes.name: Eyjafjalla

attributes.content: Ahem, well then... Today is the third day of the field expedition, and we've almost made it to the survey site.
attributes.name: Eyjafjalla

attributes.content: The time now is ten thirty... is that a one? Sorry, I can't see very clearly, but it's morning.
attributes.name: Eyjafjalla

attributes.content: Oh, it-it's a two now! The time is 10:32, and our ETA to the rendezvous point with Rhodes Island is... Umm, twelve hours and twenty-eight minutes.
attributes.name: Eyjafjalla

attributes.content: Everything has been going smoothly so far, and the detection rune is ready. As for the sampling equipment, the others are currently helping me with it.
attributes.name: Eyjafjalla

attributes.content: Umm, what was that? I thought I heard someone calling me...
attributes.name: Eyjafjalla

attributes.content: Ack, I almost dropped the recorder. Phew... Okay, don't panic...
attributes.name: Eyjafjalla

attributes.content: Are they waving at me? I think that signal means they finished the installation? Begin data collection... Begin synchronous analysis... G-Got it!
attributes.name: Eyjafjalla

attributes.content: Eyjafjalla!
attributes.name: Field Operator

attributes.content: Oh... Um, Barty? Hearing aids... Okay, my hearing aids are working fine.
attributes.name: Eyjafjalla

attributes.content: Woah, hold on, there's no rush! Please mind your step.
attributes.name: Barty

attributes.content: I-It's fine... Barty, I can walk on my own. The visibility here is very good, so you don't need to worry about me running into things.
attributes.name: Eyjafjalla

attributes.content: You sure? The wind's pretty strong out here though, and there are rocks jutting out all over the place. Wouldn't it be better for you to stay on the aircraft?
attributes.name: Barty

attributes.content: Besides, when I left, I told Dr. Kal'tsit I would keep you safe. Bet my whole next month's salary on it.
attributes.name: Barty

attributes.content: Ughh......
attributes.name: Eyjafjalla

attributes.content: Salad? With... Dr. Kal'tsit?
attributes.name: Eyjafjalla

attributes.content: Huh? No, I said salary, my salary!
attributes.name: Operator Barty

attributes.content: (whispers) Like hell I'd ask Dr. Kal'tsit to share a salad...
attributes.name: Operator Barty

attributes.content: Oh, umm, I see...
attributes.name: Eyjafjalla

attributes.content: Ugh... My hearing aid... I'm sure there must be some interference, maybe because the wind is too strong.
attributes.name: Eyjafjalla

attributes.content: I'm very sorry. You were just talking about your work, right?
attributes.name: Eyjafjalla

attributes.content: I know how reliable you are, Barty. You've been a great help to me on this trip. If I was alone here, even setting up this equipment would've taken all afternoon.
attributes.name: Eyjafjalla

attributes.content: Huh, by yourself? You really think you could've handled all this heavy equipment? Even given a whole afternoon...
attributes.name: Operator Barty

attributes.content: I've done it before. Back when I was in school, there were some research projects I had to carry out by myself.
attributes.name: Eyjafjalla

attributes.content: Huh, what about your classmates?
attributes.name: Operator Barty

attributes.content: Ah, well... Everyone took it differently... Those courses, they did require a bit more experience.
attributes.name: Eyjafjalla

attributes.content: Right, I almost forgot through all that small talk, you're a real accomplished scholar. I guess the other students couldn't keep up with you?
attributes.name: Operator Barty

attributes.content: But even so, they were working you way too hard back in school.
attributes.name: Operator Barty

attributes.content: It actually wasn't that bad... S-Seriously, don't worry about it. I can handle myself, I just take my time.
attributes.name: Eyjafjalla

attributes.content: But you know, after coming to Rhodes Island, it is much more convenient to get things done, whether on the landship or out in the field.
attributes.name: Eyjafjalla

attributes.content: My new hearing aids are a lot better than the ones I was using before. Dr. Kal'tsit and the Professor are both supportive of my research, and Closure even helped me renovate my room...
attributes.name: Eyjafjalla

attributes.content: The other operators always take very good care of me, just like you are now. I'm so glad I have all of you.
attributes.name: Eyjafjalla

attributes.content: You thanked me the whole way here. C'mon, you're gonna make me blush.
attributes.name: Operator Barty

attributes.content: Hey! I just came back from there. The road's real narrow, so while y'all can still pass, that heavy thing's gotta stay behind.
attributes.name: Guide

attributes.content: Ugh... Does that mean there's no way for us to get to the last sampling point?
attributes.name: Eyjafjalla

attributes.content: I said, y'all can pass. You— can— pass—.
attributes.name: Guide

attributes.content: Look, there's no need to raise your voice, okay?
attributes.name: Operator Barty

attributes.content: She's just standin' there all confused. Her ears bad or something?
attributes.name: Guide

attributes.content: Sorry... I heard you this time.
attributes.name: Eyjafjalla

attributes.content: Um, Barty, let's go take a look first?
attributes.name: Eyjafjalla

attributes.content: Wait, hold up, you're going too? I did say it's clear, but don't you think it'd be better for someone like you to take it easy?
attributes.name: Guide

attributes.content: Huh?
attributes.name: Eyjafjalla

attributes.content: The road up ahead is pretty nasty. A lot of earthquakes hit this area, and there are pits and sinkholes everywhere. One wrong move and you're stuck in one of those. Wouldn't even come out here if not for the money.
attributes.name: Guide

attributes.content: Lookin' at you, you're havin' a tough time just walkin' on flat ground, and now you wanna join in on this craziness? Isn't that just looking for trouble?
attributes.name: Guide

attributes.content: You... How dare you talk like that to Eyjafjalla! She may be young, but she's the greatest volcanologist in the world! She's in charge of this whole expedition!
attributes.name: Operator Barty

attributes.content: Volcanology gonna pick her up and carry her? The only thing gettin' you across this road is a sturdy pair o' legs.
attributes.name: Guide

attributes.content: I guess you have a point... Um, Eyjafjalla... He's kinda right. If the road ahead is really that rough, you should...
attributes.name: Operator Barty

attributes.content: Oh...
attributes.name: Eyjafjalla

attributes.content: Barty, Mr. Guide, I am very sorry... for causing you trouble.
attributes.name: Eyjafjalla

attributes.content: But, I need to go.
attributes.name: Eyjafjalla

attributes.content: If you're concerned about the equipment, I can set it up for you—
attributes.name: Operator Barty

attributes.content: Yes, I know. What you said is true. But, the source of the anomalous Originium readings is right up ahead. We need more precise detection method, and that requires my Arts.
attributes.name: Eyjafjalla

attributes.content: Why not use the data from the sampling sites? There's a lot to pick from, right?
attributes.name: Operator Barty

attributes.content: No good. We can't overlook even the smallest detail if we want accurate results. If I get lazy here, our entire mission may fall short.
attributes.name: Eyjafjalla

attributes.content: I know that serious look, you've made up your mind... then we've got no choice. Let's go.
attributes.name: Operator Barty

attributes.content: But let me get this out of the way, Eyjafjalla, if you ever feel uncomfortable, we're going to stop to take a break. You've got a duty to your research, but I've got a duty to protect you.
attributes.name: Operator Barty

attributes.content: Okay... I'll be fine, Barty. Don't worry about me.
attributes.name: Eyjafjalla

attributes.content: *Sigh*... I can tell you're pushing yourself!
attributes.name: Operator Barty

attributes.content: Tsk... If you don't like hearing the truth...
attributes.name: Guide

attributes.content: Let me just make this clear. If somethin' happens, I'm only gonna be lookin' after myself.
attributes.name: Guide

attributes.content: Damn it, people like you...
attributes.name: Operator Barty

attributes.content: It's fine, don't worry about it. Thank you for showing us the way, Mr. Guide.
attributes.name: Eyjafjalla

attributes.content: Continuing recording... The current time is 12:25 P.M., and we're moving towards the last sampling site.
attributes.name: Eyjafjalla

attributes.content: We've analyzed the data from the previous sampling site and... Well, it's pretty much what I predicted.
attributes.name: Eyjafjalla

attributes.content: Despite being igneous rock deposited by an ancient volcano, there's still strong Originium activity deep within it. It continues to grow stronger, and the trend is... undeniable.
attributes.name: Eyjafjalla

attributes.content: The key lies in the core of the anomalous band... With that data, we'll be able to analyze the trajectory of change... I hope it won't interfere with Rhodes Island's subsequent— Eek!
attributes.name: Eyjafjalla

attributes.content: I, I just bumped my shoulder on something... Sorry, Barty... I wasn't watching where I was going.
attributes.name: Eyjafjalla

attributes.content: Is everything okay? We've been walking for an hour already.
attributes.name: Operator Barty

attributes.content: Ah... Um... Yeah, I'm fine.
attributes.name: Eyjafjalla

attributes.content: The wind is really strong here, stronger than before. It's making its way into the cracks of the rocks, just like us.
attributes.name: Operator Barty

attributes.content: Yeah... It's really cold... My legs are all sore, and my eyes...
attributes.name: Eyjafjalla

attributes.content: Ugh...
attributes.name: Eyjafjalla

attributes.content: But, I can do this. Please keep going.
attributes.name: Eyjafjalla

attributes.content: You're really not going to let anything stop you, huh?
attributes.name: Operator Barty

attributes.content: Tell you what. You stand behind me, I'm big enough to block the wind for you. If there are any rocks, I'll get us out of the way.
attributes.name: Operator Barty

attributes.content: Okay... Sounds good. Thank you, Barty.
attributes.name: Eyjafjalla

attributes.content: Hey... Don't say I didn't warn you. This road's hard to get through.
attributes.name: Guide

attributes.content: So, what kind of treasure are you lookin' for? Must be great to get you pushin' through all this.
attributes.name: Guide

attributes.content: I think we told you back when we hired you? We're from Rhodes Island, a pharmaceutical company, and we're here to investigate and research—
attributes.name: Operator Barty

attributes.content: Yeah, yeah, I heard all that before.
attributes.name: Guide

attributes.content: But like what investigation, what research? Isn't it all about money in the end?
attributes.name: Guide

attributes.content: Heh, especially pharmaceutical companies like yours. I bet you've squeezed a whole lot of old rich folk desperately trying to survive, right?
attributes.name: Guide

attributes.content: You... you wouldn't get it.
attributes.name: Operator Barty

attributes.content: There's nothing wrong with trying to make money, but some things you can't put a price on.
attributes.name: Operator Barty

attributes.content: Hm? Not here for money then? I was gonna say... how'd you plan to make money digging for rocks?
attributes.name: Guide

attributes.content: Right, now that I think about it, there are some people, underlings working for those old aristocrats, always trying to play around with Arts. Always experimenting with things, researching things...
attributes.name: Guide

attributes.content: Terrible... just terrible...
attributes.name: Guide

attributes.content: Hey you... Why are you trembling? I told you already, we're nothing like that...
attributes.name: Operator Barty

attributes.content: Look out!
attributes.name: Eyjafjalla

attributes.content: *gasp*... Wooahhh! What the hell is that massive boulder?!
attributes.name: Guide

attributes.content: My head... My head... Oh, it's still there?
attributes.name: Guide

attributes.content: Wasn't that huge boulder flying towards my head just a moment ago? I thought I was a goner for sure...
attributes.name: Guide

attributes.content: Ow, what's this red stuff? And what's with the debris all over the ground? This bubbly stuff... magma? From a volcano?
attributes.name: Guide

attributes.content: Did the volcano erupt?! H-Help! I don't wanna die!
attributes.name: Guide

attributes.content: Shut up already!
attributes.name: Operator Barty

attributes.content: Damn, I've been wanting to say that for the longest time...
attributes.name: Operator Barty

attributes.content: Eyjafjalla... Eyjafjalla?! Are you all right?
attributes.name: Operator Barty

attributes.content: Are you looking for me, Barty? I'm perfectly fine, right over here. Nobody got hurt by that falling boulder just now, right?
attributes.name: Eyjafjalla

attributes.content: I think we're all okay. When I saw that thing coming at us, I thought it was too late— Wait, did you destroy that boulder with your Arts?
attributes.name: Operator Barty

attributes.content: Yes. As long as everyone's safe.
attributes.name: Eyjafjalla

attributes.content: Incredible... Even I didn't have a chance to react... And despite your eyes and ears...
attributes.name: Operator Barty

attributes.content: You're right, Barty. I didn't hear anything. And I only vaguely saw a shadow.
attributes.name: Eyjafjalla

attributes.content: But what I could feel... was the change in heat.
attributes.name: Eyjafjalla

attributes.content: As Mr. Guide here also mentioned, the stone here is unstable. When affected by the strong winds, the rock formation fractures, and the friction between the fault and the rock mass generates a significant amount of heat.
attributes.name: Eyjafjalla

attributes.content: Wow! Eyjafjalla, you're awesome, really!
attributes.name: Operator Barty

attributes.content: Amazing... and kinda scary...
attributes.name: Guide

attributes.content: In just a flash, a single moment! That huge boulder, reduced to molten fragments!
attributes.name: Guide

attributes.content: My god... if that thing had smashed into my head—
attributes.name: Guide

attributes.content: Got it, shutting up. Shutting up.
attributes.name: Guide

attributes.content: Ah, we've finally arrived.
attributes.name: Eyjafjalla

attributes.content: Right now it's... Oh, we're fifteen minutes behind schedule. Let's pick up the pace.
attributes.name: Eyjafjalla

attributes.content: Booting up the equipment... still need to improve accuracy by fifteen percent... Frequency control, oscillating flow rate... Okay... Nine percent... Three percent...
attributes.name: Eyjafjalla

attributes.content: Great, noise readings are into the ideal range. Barty, you can let go now.
attributes.name: Eyjafjalla

attributes.content: This... this is also Arts?
attributes.name: Guide

attributes.content: Yes, this indeed is my Originium technique. You can think of it as Arts, but I prefer to call it a scientific research method.
attributes.name: Eyjafjalla

attributes.content: Incredible...
attributes.name: Guide

attributes.content: Mr. Guide, you must be tired as well? We can head up and rest for a bit. Sample collection will take a while to finish, so we'll have about five hours before we have to check back on the equipment.
attributes.name: Eyjafjalla

attributes.content: So this is a scientist... A real scientist. Even though she's so young, she's got some real weighty words.
attributes.name: Guide

attributes.content: Also, you just saved my life. And I'm the kind of person who knows a good one.
attributes.name: Guide

attributes.content: Tell you what, I'll take the prepaid part of the guide fee. You don't have to pay the rest.
attributes.name: Guide

attributes.content: Huh?
attributes.name: Eyjafjalla

attributes.content: Look, how many times do we have to tell you... Rhodes Island isn't that stingy—
attributes.name: Operator Barty

attributes.content: Mm... Um, Barty... If Mr. Guide insists, I think we should accept his gratitude.
attributes.name: Eyjafjalla

attributes.content: Huh? Oh, I see... Well, if you say so, Eyjafjalla, I guess we could do that.
attributes.name: Operator Barty

attributes.content: (low voice) I must say, I'm a little surprised...
attributes.name: Operator Barty

attributes.content: What did you say, Barty? Sorry, but I couldn't hear you clearly.
attributes.name: Eyjafjalla

attributes.content: Haha, it's nothing. I'm just saying, I didn't expect you to be so perceptive about this kind of stuff.
attributes.name: Operator Barty

attributes.content: Huh? Actually... it's kind of awkward when you put it that way...
attributes.name: Eyjafjalla

attributes.content: I guess I don't really understand what Mr. Guide is talking about.
attributes.name: Eyjafjalla

attributes.content: Huh?
attributes.name: Operator Barty

attributes.content: In any case... Um, my hearing aids still don't work very well... But Mr. Guide looked really sincere and seemed to be thanking us...
attributes.name: Eyjafjalla

attributes.content: Did I misunderstand something?
attributes.name: Eyjafjalla

attributes.content: I guess not... Ahaha... You really are a true scholar, aren't you?
attributes.name: Operator Barty

attributes.content: You can look past the superficial noise and cut straight to the truth at just a glance.
attributes.name: Operator Barty

attributes.content: Errmmm... O-Okay...
attributes.name: Eyjafjalla

attributes.content: The time is now 3:14 P.M. Data collection and analysis are progressing steadily.
attributes.name: Eyjafjalla

attributes.content: A small incident occurred just now on the way to the last sampling site. Of course, it hasn't affected our work.
attributes.name: Eyjafjalla

attributes.content: I also had some interesting conversations with Mr. Guide and Operator Barty along the way...
attributes.name: Eyjafjalla

attributes.content: Even though I'm not sure I understood everything they meant, I think Barty said I'm a true scholar...
attributes.name: Eyjafjalla

attributes.content: I blushed a little when I heard that... and it also made me think of something that happened before I left.
attributes.name: Eyjafjalla

attributes.content: I won't allow it! Eyjafjalla, given your physical condition, you are forbidden to work outdoors again!
attributes.name: Medic Operator

attributes.content: B-But... the anomalous Originium signal is likely related to volcanic activity, and it happens to be situated on Rhodes Island's next route.
attributes.name: Eyjafjalla

attributes.content: Both as a volcanologist and as an Operator of Rhodes Island, I must complete this field survey.
attributes.name: Eyjafjalla

attributes.content: But your health...
attributes.name: Medic Operator

attributes.content: Please have faith in me. I know how to take care of myself.
attributes.name: Eyjafjalla

attributes.content: Let her go.
attributes.name: Ceylon

attributes.content: Huh? Ceylon? You're a medic. How can you support the patient's irresponsible actions?
attributes.name: Medic Operator

attributes.content: Sure, even if it's irresponsible...
attributes.name: Ceylon

attributes.content: I also consider myself an academic of sorts, so I can kind of understand how she feels.
attributes.name: Ceylon

attributes.content: In other words, if I was given an opportunity to learn more about Originium, I'd definitely do everything within my power to make that happen.
attributes.name: Ceylon

attributes.content: I know, but... I'm just worried that another mission would worsen her condition further.
attributes.name: Medic Operator

attributes.content: That would make me want to go even more.
attributes.name: Ceylon

attributes.content: What?!
attributes.name: Medic Operator

attributes.content: Time is short, but the truth is still far away— and that's why we're even more eager to seize every opportunity, every day.
attributes.name: Ceylon

attributes.content: While I still can... while my legs can still support me... While my eyes... can still see that light... the brightness of the volcanoes.
attributes.name: Eyjafjalla

attributes.content: Yes, those lights... A an armchair scientist like me might not be able to see them, but I know Eyjafjalla can.
attributes.name: Ceylon

attributes.content: Scholars like her have always been on the bleeding edge, pushing this world's knowledge forward. Every time she can move forward is another step that we'll be able to follow.
attributes.name: Ceylon

attributes.content: Moving forward may not always be a good thing. It might be scary, and it might trip you up. But I'm not going to stop Eyjafjalla's progress just because I'm worried she'll get hurt.
attributes.name: Ceylon

attributes.content: I see...
attributes.name: Medic Operator

attributes.content: Whatever... I'll never understand you academic types.
attributes.name: Medic Operator

attributes.content: Alright, if you insist, Eyjafjalla, I won't try to stop you. You'll have to take it up with Dr. Kal'tsit!
attributes.name: Medic Operator

attributes.content: Right... Thank you. Thank you so much, and you as well, Miss Ceylon.
attributes.name: Eyjafjalla

attributes.content: That was the same topic back there.
attributes.name: Eyjafjalla

attributes.content: What does it mean to be a scholar, a scientist? I don't think I've ever given this much thought.
attributes.name: Eyjafjalla

attributes.content: Ceylon was right. I wanted to delve deeper into these volcanoes, to explore the mystery of the deepest parts of this land while I still have the time.
attributes.name: Eyjafjalla

attributes.content: When I was young, if I had to think of what was a true scholar, I would have thought of my mom and dad...
attributes.name: Eyjafjalla

attributes.content: But now, there's one more person.
attributes.name: Eyjafjalla

attributes.content: So, can you tell me the answer to this question when I get back—— Professor?
attributes.name: Eyjafjalla
